title.rendered: Transforming a literacy lesson with Google Earth

content.rendered:
Tom Barrett

Tom Barrett is a Year 5 primary school teacher, ICT Subject Leader and Assistant Head Teacher in a large primary school in Nottinghamshire, England. He has been blogging at edte.ch about the implementation of learning technology for over 3 years.

Here, he talks about the way in which his class used Google Earth to support their writing in a lesson that focused on the book ‘James and the Giant Peach’ and demonstrates how the program can be embedded in normal classroom practice.

You can follow Tom on Twitter: @tombarrett or his blog.
